title: Special attacks

properties.name: description
properties.value: Some weapons in Old School RuneScape have special attacks available for them. There are many types of special attacks, from temporary boosts in stats, to strikes dealing extra damage. They are activated by the player by clicking on the special attack bar under the Combat Options interface, or on the minimap orb (excluding PvP areas). Hovering over the special attack bar will show a tooltip with the weapon's special attack's name and description.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Weapon Special attack
"Spec" redirects here. For the shield, see Spectral spirit shield.
A full special attack bar.

Some weapons in Old School RuneScape have special attacks available for them. There are many types of special attacks, from temporary boosts in stats, to strikes dealing extra damage. They are activated by the player by clicking on the special attack bar under the Combat Options interface, or on the minimap orb (excluding PvP areas). Hovering over the special attack bar will show a tooltip with the weapon's special attack's name and description.

Special attacks have an energy bar that is drained when you use the attack; this is drained of varying amounts according to which weapon is used. The special energy bar regenerates at a rate of 10% every 30 seconds, or five (5) minutes to regenerate from empty to full. The bar will not regenerate while a player is logged out, nor will it regenerate if a player has their bank window open. The special attack bar also does not regenerate on death or upon exiting the Clan Wars portal. However, the Elidinis Statuette at Nardah, a restoration pool or higher in player-owned houses, exiting Chambers of Xeric and Theatre of Blood, and exiting a Nightmare Zone dream fully restore special attack energy.

The energy bar is related to the player, not to the weapon - in other words, changing weapons does not change the special energy bar.

On PvP worlds or in the Wilderness, players are prevented from teleporting for a few seconds after using an offensive special attack in PvP combat. This is done to prevent players from using their special attack on a player and immediately teleporting away without consequence.

A player fighting the stranger who uses the dragon dagger's special attack.

While players are the most common users of special attacks, NPCs are known to use them too. The stranger that may be encountered during Desert Treasure is capable of using his dragon dagger's special attack. He does not seem to be limited by a special attack bar and can even unleash consecutive special attacks per game tick.

Melee weapons[edit | edit source]

Abyssal Weaponry[edit | edit source]

Abyssal bludgeon
Name Penance
Energy used 50%
Description An attack that deals 0.5% extra damage for every prayer point the attacker is missing.
Level 70

Abyssal dagger • Abyssal dagger (p) • (p+) • (p++)
Name Abyssal Puncture
Energy used 50%
Description A double attack that deals 15% less damage with 25% more accuracy. If the first attack hits, so will the second attack. Otherwise, both attacks will miss.
Defence roll Slash
Attack roll modifier 25%
Damage modifier -15%
Level 70

Name Binding Tentacle
Energy used 50%
Description Binds an opponent for 5 seconds and increases opponent's chance of being poisoned.
Attack roll modifier 25%

Name Energy Drain
Energy used 50%

Ancient Warriors' Weaponry[edit | edit source]

Statius's warhammer
Name Smash
Energy used 35%
Description An attack that deals anywhere between 25% and 125% of the user's standard max hit and lowers the target's current Defence level by 30% on a hit other than 0 (stackable; relative to current level).
Level 78
Vesta's longsword • Vesta's blighted longsword
Name Feint
Energy used 25%
Description An attack that deals anywhere between 20% and 120% of the user's standard max hit; the accuracy of this special attack is rolled against 25% of the opponent's defence.

Name Spear Wall
Energy used 50%
Description An attack that damages up to 16 targets within 8 tiles surrounding the player. Outside of multicombat zones, only one target is damaged. In addition, the user becomes immune to melee attacks for 8 ticks (4.8 seconds).

Shields[edit | edit source]

Bulwarks[edit | edit source]

Bulwarks are two-handed shields that can be used both offensively and defensively. Dinh's Bulwark receives a 20% damage reduction in non-PvP battles when it is used in the defensive stance. In this stance, it is unable to make attacks and cannot cast spells.

Dinh's bulwark
Name Shield Bash
Energy used 50%
Description Attacks surrounding targets in a 11x11 area with 20% increased accuracy. Targeted monsters get hit twice, except in pvp. In addition, the target's highest offensive stat will be reduced by 5% when hit (regardless if it was successful or not). If all stats are equal, it will drain both Attack and Strength, then Ranged, or Magic.
Level 75
Level 75

Dragonfire[edit | edit source]

The dragonfire shield and dragonfire ward can discharge a fireball hitting around 25 damage at an opponent. It doesn't use any special attack energy, but the attack can only be used once the shield has cooled down every two minutes.

Dragonfire shield
Energy used 0%
Description Use one charge to unleash a blast of dragonfire at a target once every two minutes, which can hit approximately 25 damage, up to 13 spaces away.
Level 75
Quest Dragon Slayer I (started)
Dragonfire ward
Energy used 0%
Description Use one charge to unleash a blast of dragonfire at a target once every two minutes, which can hit approximately 25 damage, up to 13 spaces away.
Level 70
Level 75
Quest Dragon Slayer I (started)

Ice breath[edit | edit source]

The ancient wyvern shield can discharge an icy breath attack at an opponent. It doesn't use any special attack energy, but once the shield has been activated, there is a cooldown before the player can use it again.

Ancient wyvern shield
Energy used 0%
Description When activated, the shield lets out a Wyvern-like attack and the target's stats are lowered accordingly. This attack also has a chance of freezing the target.
Level 70
Level 75
Quest Dragon Slayer I (started)

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
29 May 2014
(update)

The special attack button now shows the percentage of energy you've got and indicates whether you have enough to perform the special attack with your current weapon.

10 April 2014
(update)

Special attack energy now restores while interfaces such as the bank are open.

3 April 2014
(update)

Melee weapon special attacks now correctly utilise Slayer helm, Black mask & Salve amulet bonuses.

See also[edit | edit source]

  • Enchanted bolts
  • Passive effect

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Previously, within the game itself, weapons did not have names for their special attacks, nor were their effects documented in game; they were only found in the discontinued Knowledge Base on the RuneScape website. It was not until an update on 24 August 2017 that they were officially added in game after passing the poll question in Old School Content Poll 56: Quality of Life.
    • For weapons released after the release of Old School RuneScape, Jagex created their own special attack names, while adopting some that were already on this article.
  • During the Misthalin Mystery quest, Mandy uses the Bandos godsword special attack when slaying Abigale.

It was not until [[Update:Remember username, tooltips, and Wilderness Wars!|an update]] on [[24 August]] [[2017]] that they were officially added in game after passing the [[poll]] question in ''[[Poll:Old School Content Poll 56: Quality of Life|Old School Content Poll 56: Quality of Life]]''. **For weapons released after the release of ''Old School RuneScape'', Jagex created their own special attack names, while adopting some that were already on this article. *During the [[Misthalin Mystery]] [[quests|quest]], [[Mandy]] uses the [[Bandos godsword]] special attack when slaying [[Abigale]].
